thread.title: From Brexit to breaking news - how many of the biggest stories of 2016 do you remember?
thread.title_full: From Brexit to breaking news - how many of the biggest stories of 2016 do you remember?

author: chroniclelive.co.uk
title: From Brexit to breaking news - how many of the biggest stories of 2016 do you remember?
text:
Brendan Healy: Highlights of some of his best jokes Share this video Watch Next 
Also in February popular entertainer Brendan Healy died after a long battle with cancer. 
A huge personality, Brendan, who was 59, was known to generations of families – as a musician, actor, comedian and for also being part of the team behind the `Geordie’ pantomimes at the Tyne Theatre and Opera House in Newcastle. Kian Musgrove, pictured with his mother Kat 
Toddler Kian Musgrove received a boost when pop supremo Simon Cowell stepped in to donate £25,000 to the fund for the youngster. 
Kian, who is fighting cancer, and his family needed money to pay for travel and treatment in the USA. 
The Chronicle have covered brave Kian’s battles over the last year. MARCH Police and the Bomb Disposal Unit attend a suspicious package on Old Elvet, Durham 
The most read story on the Chronicle website in March was about a bomb scare in Durham City centre . 
A bomb disposal unit carried out two controlled explosions in Durham City Centre after a suitcase was abandoned on a street. 
Police came across the “suspicious package”, which was later found to have DVDs and CDs in it, at around 9.30am when dealing with an overnight break in at a flat on Old Elvet. 
The operation lasted for several hours and caused widespread disruption. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
One story that had our audience aghast was a supposed ‘Geordie’ accent on an American TV show. 
The offending interpretation of our lovely dialect appeared on an episode of American show Castle which involves lead character Richard Castle getting himself into all sorts of interesting scenarios. 
Our readers told us what they thought - and everyone agreed it was a poor effort. Denise Robertson (Photo: Ken McKay) 
On the last day of March TV agony aunt Denise Robertson passed away a short while after a pancreatic cancer diagnosis. 
Sunderland born Denise, 83, was a staple on ITV’s This Morning for many years. 
Her family said in a statement: “The world has lost an extraordinary woman.” APRIL Tyler Garwood, 14, who has died after suspected meningitis 
The heartbroken parents of Tyler Garwood paid tribute to the popular teenager following his sudden death following a suspected case of meningitis. 
The 14-year-old aspiring goalkeeper was struck down by the killer disease despite being fit and healthy. 
Tyler took ill on Sunday April 24 when he started shivering during the first half of a match, by the following evening he had passed away. 
Mum-of-two Angela said at the time: “I can’t express how much I miss him and love him, I wish I could trade places with him. He’s too young, just far too young.” Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
